intro: Primula warshenewskiana, commonly known as the Warshenewskya primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters, featuring basal rosettes of broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in early spring. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
